text.p: -- Donaldson, Lufkin & Jenrette said it raised Applied Materials Inc to buy from market perform.
-- DLJ said it raised the 1997 earnings estimates to $2.15 a share from $1.80 a share. Raised the 1998 earnings estimates to $3.25 a share from $2.50 a share.
-- DLJ set a 12-month price target of $65 a share.
-- Late on Tuesday, Applied Materials posted a drop in net earnings, but said orders were up over the previous quarter.
-- DLJ said the company's new orders of $905 millon topped Wall Street estimates of $800 million.
-- DLJ said dynamic random access memory chip (DRAM) market has falled to 33 percent of Applied Material's business, down from 24 percent.
-- DLJ said the DRAM sector is still very weak.
-- Applied Materials gained 4-7/8 to 50 in morning trading.
